venue.address_2: cross street Center between Chapel and Crown
venue.name: Bentara

item.description:
Come down and see what is in the works with entrepreneurs, and creative minds in our own community.
This is a well attended event get there early if you can so we can hold a table.

PechaKucha Night
New Haven Volume #4
at Bentara
STARTS at 7:30

New Haven has it's own edition of PechaKucha Night, an event that celebrates creativity and innovation. It was founded by designers in Tokyo as a way to share ideas succinctly and creatively. The event has grown to include anyone and everyone in cities around the world; individuals or groups present creative ideas or innovations using 20 images shown for 20 seconds each. The ideas can solve social problems or just be a cool innovation, or new project. Neighbors, colleagues, journalists, designers, architects, social entrepreneurs, and artists have all presented at PechaKucha nights. Check out our New Haven page (and the global website) for more info:
http://www.pecha-kuch...


presenters:
Spring edition Presenters:

Commonsensualist: David Lasagne finds a path across the partisan divide to regain our sanity

Maryann Ott takes us on an international Eclipse Chase

Filmmaker Hank Mandel explores the Male Psyche

JoAnne Wilcox talks Trash Indications

Tim Dolan explores unlimited potential, versatility, and ability to sustain life in Ubiquitous Hydrogen -- the Expose'

WVRA takes us on an ArtWalk

Mike Quirk Draws us into a New Perspective

Architecture for Humanity shows us what it looks like when you Design Like You Give A Damn,

Big Brothers Big Sisters show us What We Can Do

Jay Bright Restores us.

Admission is free... although you'll need your usual amount at the bar...

Bentara
76 Orange Street, New Haven (the block between Chapel and Crown)
(203) 562-2511
http://www.bentara.co...
item.how_to_find_us: check out the faces of those attending, we will get there early to hold a table, send me a note if you are concerned with connecting.
item.name: PechaKucha Night
